reviewText: Hokey dangers of uranium anti snake oil film but it gets 4 stars for being exactly that. There is a reason to watch these kinds of black and white films and this one is a good example. It isn't steamy or gritty or directed by a great noir legend. It is great Saturday theater fare. Some not too bad bad guys, not too slick or beautiful good guys and dames, a little PSA preachy. Just what it was supposed to be, good old fashioned hokey corn.
One scene shows the main characters dining at a night club (including Grace Bradley). The background music played by the band is the same song sung by Grace in 'Sitting on the Moon', one year before.
Started slow but plot developed, and is a great movie with a fine cast.
It started out kind of strange, but had a very happy ending.
